data.taskTitle: why is there no paste avail on right click on monaco editor?
why is there no paste avail on right click on monaco editor?
data.approach: Investigate Monaco editor context menu configuration. The screenshot shows Cut, Copy, Change All Occurrences, and Command Palette but no Paste option. Will search for contextmenu configuration in Monaco wrapper and related components.

data.taskTitle: why is there no paste avail on right click on monaco editor?
summary: Added custom Paste action to Monaco editor context menu
Monaco does not include Paste by default because it uses custom DOM instead of native input/textarea elements
Used editor.addAction() API to add Paste that uses Clipboard API
reviewFocus: Verify Paste appears in Monaco context menu
Test that pasting text works correctly

suggestedTasks.title: Implement Right-Click Paste Functionality in Monaco Editor
suggestedTasks.description: Add custom paste event handling for Monaco Editor to enable right-click paste. This requires investigating Monaco Editor's current event configuration and implementing a custom paste event listener that integrates with the browser's clipboard API. The fix should work across different browsers and maintain the editor's existing interaction patterns.
suggestedTasks.reason: Core editing functionality is currently impaired

suggestedTasks.title: Add Browser Clipboard Interaction Tests for Monaco Editor
suggestedTasks.description: Create comprehensive test suite to validate clipboard interactions in Monaco Editor, including right-click paste, keyboard shortcut paste, and cross-browser compatibility. Tests should cover different content types, editor states, and ensure consistent paste behavior.
suggestedTasks.reason: Discovered need for more robust clipboard interaction testing

patterns: Check for custom event handling in editor setup
gotchas: Browser clipboard APIs can vary in implementation
